using_DB.schema_describtion:
-accounts:This table consists the information of all the clients. One client would have exactly one account number. There are multiple accounts/clients in this table. For example the account number of the client wowskin science is 71. Columns are ['id','name','created_at','updated_at','locale','domain','support_email','settings_flags','feature_flags','auto_resolve_duration','concurrency_enabled','concurrency_limit','username','password','agent_analytic_id','hide_all_tab','currency','shopify_access_token','source','preferred_billing_currency','shopify_store_url','on_grace_period','shopify_deleted','shopify_app_reinstalled','shopify_country_name','shopify_country_code','billing_email','hide_queued_tab','payment_pending','on_shopify_custom_plan','hide_bot_conversations','is_enterprise','website_url','enforce_tagging','grace_extension','ums_enabled','deleted_at','hide_out_of_stock','template_last_synced_at'].column 'id' is the primary key of the table accounts.
-contacts: Stores all information about the contacts (customers) which interact with Limechat. Typically we try to get the phone number, name and email id. For instagram bot, we get the username. Contact information is very important for us, helps us map Orders placed (phone_number info) with the conversation/messages (contact_id) taking place. Columns are ['id','name','email','phone_number','account_id','created_at','updated_at','pubsub_token', 'identifier','instagram_username','opt_in','address','conversations_count'].Column 'id' is the primary key of the table contacts.
-messages: Collection of each and every message sent by the agent, customer, or bot using sender_type, basically gives us the source of the message. Mainly used to get the count of outgoing or incoming messages. Also, we have the message_type to segregate type of message like outbound_bot or csat_feedback. Columns are ['id','content','account_id','inbox_id','conversation_id','message_type','created_at','updated_at','private','status','source_id','content_type','sender_type','sender_id','template_id','broadcast_id','email_draft','identifier','ums_message_id','is_echo','echo_type','parent_message_id','ums_message_source'].
-conversations: Stores information about each new conversation that gets created. Columns are ['id','account_id','inbox_id','status','assignee_id','created_at','updated_at','contact_id','display_id','contact_last_seen_at','agent_last_seen_at','locked','contact_inbox_id','uuid','identifier','rasa_conv_id','last_activity_at','team_id','starred','alert','alert_dispatch_id','close_dispatch_id','unread','new_filter','opened_at','assigned_by','resolved_by','closed_by','previous_assignee_id','assigned_by_resource_id','is_conv_marketing','assigned_at','in_reply_to_email','crm_ticket_id','external_uuid','assignee_version','status_changed_at','facebook_post_id'].Column 'account_id' is a foreign key of table conversations.
-agent_analytics: A single entry in this table can be uniquely identified by conversation_id and assignee_id. A conversation can be assigned to different agents at different points of time. This table will have a different entry for that conversation for different agents. Their frt's(first response time) is for this conversation and avg_wait_time of this agent. Columns are ['id','conversation_id','created_at','updated_at','assignee_id','first_assigned_time','first_agent_message_time','agent_frt','last_resolution_time','agent_resolution_time','average_agent_wait_time','agent_turns','is_resolved','last_agent_message_time','last_contact_message_time','active','account_id','inbox_id','is_outside_working_hours','is_outbound','self_assign','is_auto_resolved'].Column 'id' is the primary key, column 'conversation_id' and column 'account_id' are the foreign keys of the table agent_analytics.
-inboxes:Inboxes can also be considered as different channels. There can be multiple channels/inboxes for an account. All tickets are associated with one channel/inboxes only. For example let's say a brand/client have 3 WhatsApp number active, 1 fb channel/inboxes, 1 insta channel/inboxes. So, in our platform will have 5 channel/inboxes. Columns are ['id','channel_id','account_id','name','created_at','updated_at','channel_type','greeting_enabled','greeting_message','away_message','start_time','end_time','status','email_address','working_hours_enabled','out_of_office_message','email_collect_enabled','auto_close_duration','auto_resolve_duration','auto_alert_duration','enable_auto_assignment','widget_bot_name','enable_agent_offline','timezone','bot_handoff_away','csat_survey_enabled','wait_time_enabled','csat_message','auto_resolve_bot_duration','wait_time_message','opt_in_key','opt_out_key',csat_question','deleted_at','opt_out_enabled','opt_out_message','ums_enabled','send_csat_for_ooo','wa_widget_access_token','send_csat_for_auto_resolved_conversation','wa_csat_enabled'].Column 'id' is the primary key of the table inboxes.
